title: The Masked Singer Australia: YouTubers claim producers STOLE their arrangement of Billie Eilish hit
text:
A YouTube singing duo has accused producers from The Masked Singer Australia of stealing their composition of Billie Eilish's hit Bad Guy for Kate Ceberano.

Kate, who performed as the Lion on the show, wowed judges with her edgy rendition of the song in episode three.

But musicians Brad Amick and Addie Nicole, of the band Halocene, have claimed the cpver was a 'carbon copy' of the version they released in April.

Scroll down for Halocene's recording

The Arizona-based duo, who have been recording hits for YouTube for almost 10 years, made the claims in a video uploaded to the platform on Tuesday.

Their version of Bad Guy was released on YouTube on April 29, 2019, and The Masked Singer Australia was filmed in Sydney three months later in July 2019.

In the 12-minute long recording, Brad hit out at the hit show's producers over the alleged theft.

He said: 'Here we learn that a multi-million dollar reality TV show called the Masked Singer Australia has stolen, note for note, beat for beat, our musical arrangement of Bad Guy.

'It's a song we covered and published 22 weeks prior to their show date.'

Claims: Brad Amick and Addie Nicole (pictured), of the band Halocene, have claimed the performance was a 'carbon copy' of their version

The musicians claimed someone from the show's music department had gone through the 'intricate details' of their version in a bid to replicate it for the show.

Brad said: 'There are things that aren't even present in the Billie Eilish version which include distinct chord changes, the guitar, the bass lines, instrumental melodies, vocals.

'There's no way it could be construed as just inspiration. It's virtually a carbon copy.'

The video then goes on to show both their version and the recording of Kate's Masked Singer performance played side by side.

They also shared a clip of Kate being interviewed after she was unmasked.

Discussing how she chose which songs to cover during her stint on the show, Kate said she was inspired by her daughter's music playlists.

There is no suggestion Kate had any involvement with the accusations.

As well as making the allegations on YouTube, the duo also have launched a GoFundMe page to raise money for possible legal action.

Unmasked: Kate Cebrano (pictured) who performed as the Lion on the show, wowed judges with her rendition of the Billie Eilish hit in episode three

They hope to raise $15,000 (USD) to fund 'international legal representation'.

The band wrote: 'We have simply worked too hard, and too long, to sit by the way side and let a TV show make millions off a show featuring an arrangement we made.

'It's a long shot, we know, but if for some odd reason this gains traction, it'd mean everything to us to be able to have an actual chance at standing up for ourselves.'

When approached by the Courier Mail on Wednesday, Channel 10 declined to comment.

Daily Mail Australia has contacted Channel 10 for comment.
description: A YouTube singing duo has accused producers from The Masked Singer Australia of stealing their composition of Billie Eilish's hit  Bad Guy for Kate Ceberano.
authors: Jess Bell For Daily Mail Australia
